issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [http://aniwave.to](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Faniwave.to) ### Comment > The problems occurs when you pause the episode, an in-page pop-up ad-image appears in front of the screen. Though this issue can be resolved through updating the AdGuard filters, but the issue will return after a couple of months, even with the Fanboy Annoyance filter enabled, the filter that is designed to remove these in-page pop-ups. Though there was no issue until tone of the streaming servers got an update and name rebranding this issue returned, though I found a way to fix it and I thought I had resolved the issue, it reappeared again yesterday. > Like what is the issue here? How is this one in-page pop+up ad-image bypassing the AdGuard filter that is specifically designed to remove this type of annoyance? Username: `@Ian Chen` ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://www.wsj.com/business/the-new-headache-for-bosses-employees-arent-quitting-edca96a3](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Fbusiness%2Fthe-new-headache-for-bosses-employees-arent-quitting-edca96a3) ### Comment > The AdGuard Social Media filter started blocking the WSJ share button about two weeks ago. I only today troubleshooted which filter was causing the issue. > > I share a lot of "unlocked" links from the WSJ to other people and Twitter, etc. > > Fanboy's social blocking list does not make the WSJ share button disappear. > > If this was a heavily scripted third party "share to social media sites" widget, I would probably want it blocked, too, but this is just the native WSJ menu and the only way to obtain a paywall free link for other people to access. > > Also one of the few US News sites that offer a direct share to Telegram option, which is nice for those who don't use their native share to other app buttons lol. > > If you need anything else please let me know. comment.body:

> To reproduce, set `privacy.globalprivacycontrol.enabled` to true in the latest Firefox 116.0 (119.0), then confirm it’s enabled on https://globalprivacycontrol.org/.
